summary: "The Canterbury Tales" by Geoffrey Chaucer is a collection of 24 stories told by a group of pilgrims traveling from London to Canterbury to visit Saint Thomas Becket's shrine. The tales, mostly in verse, were written in Middle English between 1387 and 1400. The pilgrims compete to tell the best story, with the winner getting a free meal. Though it was unfinished, the book is seen as very important in English literature, helping to make English a popular language for writing stories.
title: The Canterbury Tales
